title: [help wanted] Reduce build verbosity to necessary minimum
body_html:
• OS: Ubuntu 16.04
  • PyTorch version: master branch in Dec 2017
  • How you installed PyTorch (conda, pip, source): local build
  • Python version: 3.6
  • GCC version (if compiling from source): 5.4.0

Is it possible to disable all messages (configuration settings, build commands, etc.) except error messages and the progress percentage during build ? There doesn't seem to be straight forward option of setting the verbosity level.
body_text:

PyTorch version: master branch in Dec 2017

Is it possible to disable all messages (configuration settings, build commands, etc.) except error messages and the progress percentage during build ? There doesn't seem to be straight forward option of setting the verbosity level.
body:
- OS: Ubuntu 16.04
- PyTorch version: master branch in Dec 2017
- How you installed PyTorch (conda, pip, source): local build
- Python version: 3.6
- GCC version (if compiling from source): 5.4.0

Is it possible to disable all messages (configuration settings, build commands, etc.) except error messages and the progress percentage during build ? There doesn't seem to be straight forward option of setting the verbosity level.
